div.l: And we willen paie · triewly at the fulle
With empty hand · men may no hawkes tulle
Lo here oure silủer · redy for to spende
This Miller to the towne his doughter sende
For Ale and brede · and Rosted hem a goos
And band theyr hors · he shuld nomore go los
And in his owne chambre · he made theym a bedde
With clothes and with chalons · faire I spredde
Nought from his owne bedde · ten feete or twelve
His doughter doughte doughter hadde a bedde · al bi hir selve
Right in the same chambre by and by
It myghte be no bet · and cause why
Ther was no rowmer herburgh in the place
But if the clerkis cowde make it more of space
They eete and drank · strong ale of the beste
Aboute mydnyght · went they to Rest
Wele had the Miller · vernysshed his hed
Ful pale he was · for drunk and nat Red
He yoxeth and spekith thurgh the nose
As he were on the quakke or on the pose
To bedde he goth · and with hym goth his wif
As any Iay she light was and Iolyf
So was hir Ioly whistil wele I wet
The cradil at hir beddis feete was set
To Rokke and to yeve · the chield sowke
And whan al was drunke · that was in the crowke
To bedde went the doughter · right anon
To bedde goth Alayn · and also Iohn
Ther was nomore hem neded no dwale
